description: systemctl - Control the systemd system and service manager

global_flags.description: Show all properties/all units currently in memory, including dead/empty ones. To list all units installed on the system, use 'list-unit-files' instead.
"yes" lets the request respect inhibitor locks.  "no" lets the request ignore inhibitor locks.
Edit unit files using the specified drop-in file name
Only print what would be done Currently supported by verbs: halt, poweroff, reboot, kexec, soft-reboot, suspend, hibernate, suspend-then-hibernate, hybrid-sleep, default, rescue, emergency, and exit.
Shortcut for --state=failed
Tell the firmware to show the setup menu on next boot
When enabling unit files, override existing symlinks When shutting down, execute action immediately
Don't ellipsize unit names on output
Edit/enable/disable/mask default user unit files globally
Show this help
Operate on remote host
Edit/enable/disable/mask unit files in the specified disk image
Specify how to deal with already queued jobs, when queueing a new job
Signal value to enqueue
Whom to send signal to
Enable/disable the legend (column headers and hints)
Number of journal entries to show
Restart/reload previously marked units
Create directory before mounting, if missing
Do not ask for system passwords
Do not wait until operation finished
Do not pipe output into a pager
Don't reload daemon after en-/dis-abling unit files
Don't send wall message before halt/power-off/reboot
Suppress several warnings shown by default
Start or stop unit after enabling or disabling it
Change journal output mode (short, short-precise, short-iso, short-iso-precise, short-full, short-monotonic, short-unix, short-delta, verbose, export, json, json-pretty, json-sse, cat)
Print unit dependencies as a list instead of a tree
Apply only enable, only disable, or all presets
Show only properties by this name
Suppress output
Create read-only bind mount
Show unit list of host and local containers
Show reverse dependencies with 'list-dependencies'
Edit/enable/disable/mask unit files in the specified root directory
Edit/enable/disable/mask unit files temporarily until next reboot
When enqueuing a unit job, show full transaction
When showing sockets, explicitly show their type

or --signal=SIGRTMAX-...), and ensures the signals are generated via the sigqueue(3) system call, rather than kill(3). The specified value must be a 32-bit signed integer, and may be specified either in decimal, in hexadecimal (if prefixed with "0x"), octal (if prefixed with "0o") or binary (if prefixed with "0b")
List units with particular LOAD or SUB or ACTIVE state
Connect to system manager
Change format of printed timestamps (pretty, unix, us, utc, us+utc)
List units of a particular type
Connect to user service manager
When showing properties, only print the value
Show package version
For (re)start, wait until service stopped again For is-system-running, wait until startup is completed
Which types of resources to remove
Schedule halt/power-off/reboot/kexec action after a certain timestamp
Shortcut for --check-inhibitors=no

subcommands.name: LISTEN
subcommands.description: UNIT                        ACTIVATES /dev/initctl     systemd-initctl.socket      systemd-initctl.service ... [::]:22          sshd.socket                 sshd.service kobject-uevent 1 systemd-udevd-kernel.socket systemd-udevd.service

subcommands.name: LOAD
subcommands.description: = Reflects whether the unit definition was properly loaded. ACTIVE = The high-level unit activation state, i.e. generalization of SUB. SUB    = The low-level unit activation state, values depend on unit type.

subcommands.name: add-requires
subcommands.description: Add 'Requires' dependency for the target on specified one or more units

subcommands.name: add-wants
subcommands.description: Add 'Wants' dependency for the target on specified one or more units

subcommands.name: bind
subcommands.description: Bind-mount a path from the host into a unit's namespace mount-image UNIT PATH [PATH [OPTS]] Mount an image from the host into a unit's namespace

subcommands.name: cancel
subcommands.description: Cancel all, one, or more jobs

subcommands.name: cat
subcommands.description: Show files and drop-ins of specified units

subcommands.name: clean
subcommands.description: Clean runtime, cache, state, logs or configuration of unit

subcommands.name: daemon-reexec
subcommands.description: Reexecute systemd manager

subcommands.name: daemon-reload
subcommands.description: Reload systemd manager configuration

subcommands.name: disable
subcommands.description: Disable one or more unit files

subcommands.name: edit
subcommands.description: Edit one or more unit files

subcommands.name: emergency
subcommands.description: Enter system emergency mode

subcommands.name: enable
subcommands.description: Enable one or more unit files

subcommands.name: freeze
subcommands.description: Freeze execution of unit processes

subcommands.name: get-default
subcommands.description: Get the name of the default target

subcommands.name: halt
subcommands.description: Shut down and halt the system

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Show manual for one or more units

subcommands.name: hibernate
subcommands.description: Hibernate the system

subcommands.name: hybrid-sleep
subcommands.description: Hibernate and suspend the system

subcommands.name: import-environment
subcommands.description: Import all or some environment variables

subcommands.name: is-active
subcommands.description: Check whether units are active

subcommands.name: is-enabled
subcommands.description: Check whether unit files are enabled

subcommands.name: is-failed
subcommands.description: Check whether units are failed or system is in degraded state

subcommands.name: is-system-running
subcommands.description: Check whether system is fully running

subcommands.name: isolate
subcommands.description: Start one unit and stop all others

subcommands.name: kexec
subcommands.description: Shut down and reboot the system with kexec

subcommands.name: kill
subcommands.description: Send signal to processes of a unit

subcommands.name: link
subcommands.description: Link one or more units files into the search path

subcommands.name: list-automounts
subcommands.description: List automount units currently in memory, ordered by path

subcommands.name: list-dependencies
subcommands.description: Recursively show units which are required or wanted by the units or by which those units are required or wanted

subcommands.name: list-jobs
subcommands.description: List jobs

subcommands.name: list-machines
subcommands.description: List local containers and host

subcommands.name: list-paths
subcommands.description: List path units currently in memory, ordered by path

subcommands.name: list-sockets
subcommands.description: List socket units currently in memory, ordered by address

subcommands.name: list-timers
subcommands.description: List timer units currently in memory, ordered by next elapse

subcommands.name: list-unit-files
subcommands.description: List installed unit files

subcommands.name: list-units
subcommands.description: List units currently in memory

subcommands.name: log-level
subcommands.description: Get/set logging threshold for manager

subcommands.name: log-target
subcommands.description: Get/set logging target for manager

subcommands.name: mask
subcommands.description: Mask one or more units

subcommands.name: poweroff
subcommands.description: Shut down and power-off the system

subcommands.name: preset
subcommands.description: Enable/disable one or more unit files based on preset configuration

subcommands.name: preset-all
subcommands.description: Enable/disable all unit files based on preset configuration

subcommands.name: reboot
subcommands.description: Shut down and reboot the system

subcommands.name: reenable
subcommands.description: Reenable one or more unit files

subcommands.name: reload
subcommands.description: Reload one or more units

subcommands.name: reload-or-restart
subcommands.description: Reload one or more units if possible, otherwise start or restart

subcommands.name: rescue
subcommands.description: Enter system rescue mode

subcommands.name: reset-failed
subcommands.description: Reset failed state for all, one, or more

subcommands.name: restart
subcommands.description: Start or restart one or more units

subcommands.name: revert
subcommands.description: Revert one or more unit files to vendor

subcommands.name: service-log-level
subcommands.description: Get/set logging threshold for service service-log-target SERVICE [TARGET] Get/set logging target for service

subcommands.name: service-watchdogs
subcommands.description: Get/set service watchdog state

subcommands.name: set-default
subcommands.description: Set the default target

subcommands.name: show
subcommands.description: Show properties of one or more units/jobs or the manager

subcommands.name: show-environment
subcommands.description: Dump environment

subcommands.name: soft-reboot
subcommands.description: Shut down and reboot userspace

subcommands.name: start
subcommands.description: Start (activate) one or more units

subcommands.name: status
subcommands.description: Show runtime status of one or more units

subcommands.name: stop
subcommands.description: Stop (deactivate) one or more units

subcommands.name: suspend
subcommands.description: Suspend the system

subcommands.name: suspend-then-hibernate
subcommands.description: Suspend the system, wake after a period of time, and hibernate

subcommands.name: switch-root
subcommands.description: Change to a different root file system

subcommands.name: thaw
subcommands.description: Resume execution of a frozen unit set-property UNIT PROPERTY=VALUE... Sets one or more properties of a unit

subcommands.name: try-reload-or-restart
subcommands.description: If active, reload one or more units, if supported, otherwise restart

subcommands.name: try-restart
subcommands.description: Restart one or more units if active

subcommands.name: unmask
subcommands.description: Unmask one or more units

subcommands.name: unset-environment
subcommands.description: Unset one or more environment variables

subcommands.name: whoami
subcommands.description: Return unit caller or specified PIDs are part of
